Respirology Case Reports https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/ This is an open access article under the terms of the http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/ ABSTRACT Lepidic adenocarcinoma is a rare subtype of lung adenocarcinoma that develops from the terminal bronchiolar and acinar epithelia of the lung. Diffuse pneumonic lepidic adenocarcinoma is associated with a poor prognosis. We present the case of a male former smoker with diffuse pneumonic lepidic adenocarcinoma. Chest CT demonstrated crazy paving infiltrate in both lungs and consolidation areas with air bronchogram in the middle lobe and lingula (Figures 1 2 3 4 5 1 2 FIGURE 1 Chest computed tomography demonstrates bilateral diffuse crazy‐paving pattern. FIGURE 2 Presence of condensation areas with air bronchogram in the middle lobe and lingula, in addition to a crazy paving pattern in both lower lobes with predominance in the right lung. FIGURE 3 No mediastinal lymphadenopathy or evidence of distant metastatic foci was evident in the mediastinal window. FIGURE 4 Atypical cells lining intact alveolar spaces. FIGURE 5 TTF‐1 strongly positive. Author Contributions Byron Saraguro Ramirez wrote this manuscript and conducted a literature review.
